WRITING.TEXT: I love your hair! And you have a gorgeous figure as well!

Hey there! I actually designed the whole thing on graph paper and made a paper version of it before I started. I used the paper as templates for the design and cut the scrap leather. I used a stitching awl for all of the white stitches. The lace work was done with suede strapping and a leather hole punch. I measured off all the holes I made. When I attached the bottom I used a super heavy weight leather and a softer leather over it. I had one side of the stitches done up the tube part and I flipped it inside out when I finished the stitches on the bottom. I added the border of leather on the top and the split ring on the side with a rivet. It took several hours to complete.
Probably sucking the souls from a few innocents...Why? Are you volunteering? ;D
Yeah, I know! At lest it's just for shits and giggles, and isn't actually worth anything!
Thank you! I spent several hours on it and I was super excited to share! :D
Yeah, my weight loss journey, and a bunch of my handmade stuff too. Not to mention all my reddit trophies. *sigh* Oh well.
No. Just a clear plastic ring.
It's a firefox, and the compound is a mission craze. ;)
Then why isn't my hair moving?

WRITING.TITLE: [CRAFTS] I designed, cut, stitched, tooled, and painted this drumstick quiver from leather remnants.

WRITING.TEXT: That's really cool! I wish I had a sewing machine!
I always feel a little uncomfortable when I post a picture of something I made. I don't want to come across as a sales person, even though I do sell my work to people who are interested. :/
Okay. Where did you find these? You look amazing in all of them, but I need that first set!

WRITING.TITLE: I've missed you, can I have a kiss?

WRITING.TEXT: It's sad what has become of reddit recently. :/
